clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Role of Hemostasis in Perioperative Anaphylaxis
clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Role of Hemostasis in Perioperative Anaphylaxis

brief_summary.textblock: Anaphylaxis is a severe and life-threatening complication during the perioperative period. Perioperative anaphylaxis is still associated with a significant mortality despite quick and efficient management using epinephrine, the mainstay of acute treatment. Experimental data and few case reports are suggesting that hemostasis, and more precisely platelets, could play a role in anaphylaxis. Our main hypothesis is that activation of the hemostatic system contributes to the severity of the reaction

primary_outcome.time_frame: As soon as possible after onset of anaphylaxis
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of: Plasmatic serotonin level, Plasmatic PF-4 level, P-selectin expression (MFI, %), Platelet count

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1-2 hours after the onset of anaphylaxis
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of: Plasmatic serotonin level, Plasmatic PF-4 level, P-selectin expression (MFI, %), Platelet count

primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after the onset of anaphylaxis
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of: Plasmatic serotonin level, Plasmatic PF-4 level, P-selectin expression (MFI, %), Platelet count

primary_outcome.time_frame: During the allergic workup (4-6 weeks after)
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of: Plasmatic serotonin level, Plasmatic PF-4 level, P-selectin expression (MFI, %), Platelet count

study_pop.textblock: The study will focus on any adult patient with a suspected diagnosis of perioperative anaphylactic shock

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient, male or female, adult
- In the perioperative period
- In whom the diagnosis of anaphylactic shock is suggested
- Patient is giving his consent to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject under legal protection
- Subject under guardianship or guardianship
- Anemia less than 7 g /dl at the time of inclusion
